messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] one typical and one LONG SCARY statement of  faith
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/8/02 9:17:16 AM, ecsamhill@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/8/02 9:17:16 AM, ecsamhill@... writes:

<< If people are only saved by faith, how come they have to be carefully
obedient for their entire lives, starting as babies? >>

To keep from being smacked by a merciful godly mother?


Oh. It wasn't a riddle. It was a theological question.

So that dads feel good when the sermon is about "but as for me and my house,
we will serve the Lord."

The father is expected to make his family behave as Christians whether
they're saved yet or not.

Sandra
